title: [K-12] Workshop on IMS LD-Based Social Studies E-Course Automatic Generation Design: Pedagogical Design for Fostering Citizenship

context.prior_knowledge: Basic IMS LD concepts, ELIDL language structure, content packaging standards, and foundational knowledge of social studies core concepts (history, geography, politics, economics, citizenship) and social issue analysis skills
context.additional_context: Strengthening interdisciplinary curriculum design capabilities based on social studies for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields. Emphasizes content development for fostering learners' citizenship and improving social issue analysis skills. Focuses on cultivating real-world problem-solving abilities using core social studies concepts such as cultural diversity, political systems, and economic structures.

learning_goals: Design and implement ≥3 specialized pedagogical templates for core social studies concepts (history, geography, citizenship, political systems, economic systems) using ELIDL language.

Learners must use three IMS LD-based social studies learning scenario templates to auto-generate a 3-step (design-review-revision) learning scenario for a Grade 5 social studies unit, submit results meeting ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation criteria (citizenship reflection, social issue analysis, cultural diversity consideration, etc.).

Within one week, learners must use a social studies ontology (1 topic: cultural diversity, political systems, or economic systems) and provided content (3 texts, 5 images, 2 videos) to complete a 3-step E-Course draft (5 lessons) following: (1) E-Course proposal, (2) storyboard design, (3) peer feedback integration. The draft must enhance social problem-solving and civic engagement competencies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
